intro: Gossia clusioides subsp. bleuensis, commonly known as the Blue Mountains gossia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Guttiferae. It is native to the humid forests of the Blue Mountains in New South Wales, Australia. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
